body.p: The undersigned Citizens of Nelson County petition His Excellency Gov Magoffin to remit so much of the forfeited Bond of Alfred Bernard upon which Carles Murphy, and Logan Bernard were Surities, as issues to the benefit of the Commonwealth, for the following reasons: The Surities upon the Bond, are poor men, Bernard himself is worth nothing, and if payment is forced of the Sureties, they will be very much distressed, and, in fact, to pay the amount of the Bond, will fall with great Severity upon them, in fact they will be ruined. Judgement was rendered against them upon the forfeited Bond at the Sept Term, of the Nelson Circuit Court, 1860. for the amount of five hundred dollars. The accused was young about 18 years of age poor, protesting that he was not guilty of the crime of rape as alledged. He had not the ^means^ of making a defense, became alarmed, and left the State
The Surities are old men, and worth very little more than the amount of the Bond Wherefore we earnestly petition His Excellency the Govenor, to release the amount due the Commonwealth.
